metadata.description: Full IELTS Listening Practice Test with 4 sections covering various topics and question types

sections.title: Total Health Clinic Patient Registration
sections.description: A conversation between a receptionist and a new patient registering at a health clinic
sections.instructions: Complete the notes below. Write ONE WORD AND/OR A NUMBER for each answer.

questions.question: Contact phone
Date of birth: ______, 1992
Occupation: works as a ______
Insurance company: ______ Life Insurance
Type of problem: pain in her left ______
When it began: ______ ago
Sports played: belongs to a ______ club
Sports played: goes ______ regularly
Medical history: injured her ______ last year
Medical history: no regular medication apart from ______

sections.title: Visit to Branley Castle
sections.description: A tour guide explaining details about visiting Branley Castle
sections.instructions: Choose the correct letters A-C for questions 11-15, and label the plan for questions 16-20.

questions.question: Before Queen Elizabeth I visited the castle in 1576,
options: A - repairs were carried out to the guest rooms
B - a new building was constructed for her
C - a fire damaged part of the main hall
questions.instructions: Choose the correct letter, A, B or C

questions.question: In 1982, the castle was sold to
options: A - the government
B - the Fenys family
C - an entertainment company
questions.instructions: Choose the correct letter, A, B or C

questions.question: In some of the rooms, visitors can
options: A - speak to experts on the history of the castle
B - interact with actors dressed as famous characters
C - see models of historical figures moving and talking
questions.instructions: Choose the correct letter, A, B or C

questions.question: In the castle park, visitors can
options: A - see an 800-year-old tree
B - go to an art exhibition
C - visit a small zoo
questions.instructions: Choose the correct letter, A, B or C

questions.question: At the end of the visit, the group will have
options: A - afternoon tea in the conservatory
B - the chance to meet the castle's owners
C - a photograph together on the Great Staircase
questions.instructions: Choose the correct letter, A, B or C

questions.question: Starting point for walking the walls

context.instructions: Label the plan below. Write the correct letter, A-H, next to Questions 16-20

context.instructions: Label the plan below. Write the correct letter, A-H, next to Questions 16-20

questions.question: Hunting birds display

context.instructions: Label the plan below. Write the correct letter, A-H, next to Questions 16-20

context.instructions: Label the plan below. Write the correct letter, A-H, next to Questions 16-20

context.instructions: Label the plan below. Write the correct letter, A-H, next to Questions 16-20

sections.title: Woolly Mammoths on St Paul's Island
sections.description: A discussion between students preparing a presentation about woolly mammoths
sections.instructions: Choose the correct letter A, B or C for questions 21-24. For questions 25-30, choose from the box A-H.

questions.question: How will Rosie and Martin introduce their presentation?
options: A - with a drawing of woolly mammoths in their natural habitat
B - with a timeline showing when woolly mammoths lived
C - with a video clip about woolly mammoths

questions.question: What was surprising about the mammoth tooth found by Russell Graham?
options: A - It was still embedded in the mammoth's jawbone
B - It was from an unknown species of mammoth
C - It was not as old as mammoth remains from elsewhere

questions.question: The students will use an animated diagram to demonstrate how the mammoths
options: A - became isolated on the island
B - spread from the island to other areas
C - coexisted with other animals on the island

questions.question: According to Martin, what is unusual about the date of the mammoths' extinction on the island?
options: A - how exact it is
B - how early it is
C - how it was established

questions.question: Introduction

context.instructions: What action will the students take for each of the following sections of their presentation? Choose SIX answers from the box and write the correct letter, A-H.
leftColumn: D - contact one of the researchers
H - organise the content more clearly
rightColumn: Initial questions asked by the researchers
Further research carried out on the island

sections.title: The History of Weather Forecasting
sections.description: A lecture about the development of weather forecasting through history
sections.instructions: Complete the notes below. Write ONE WORD ONLY for each answer.

questions.question: many cultures invented ______ and other ceremonies to make the weather gods friendly
people needed to observe and interpret the sky to ensure their ______
around 650 BC, Babylonians started forecasting, using weather phenomena such as ______
by 300 BC, the Chinese had a calendar made up of a number of ______ connected with the weather
Aristotle also described haloes and ______
many proverbs, e.g. about the significance of the colour of the ______, passed on accurate information
15th century: scientists recognised value of ______ for the first time
Galileo invented the ______
18th century: Franklin identified the movement of ______
19th century: data from different locations could be sent to the same place by ______
